com.lxisoft.battle.game.app

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lxisoft.battle.game.app.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game Engine class provides all the services for running the Dot.Com guessing game. It generates the game board, displays it, tracks user input, maintains user scores, provides methods to check the current game status and maintains important information for execution of the game.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Devanand

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(int boardSize,
          int playerCount)
        Constructor for GameEngine Class

        The constructor initializes the game engine object using the board size and player count provided. It performs the following functions:

        1. set sizeOfBoard
        2. set noOfPlayers
        3. creates new DotCom matrix of size specified by boardSize
        4. creates new Player array of size specified by playerCount
        5. initializes the BufferedReader input
        6. Sets a default name for each player in the Player[] array
        7. Initializes each cell of the Board[][] to a new DotCom object
        Parameters:
        boardSize - int : size of the board for the current instance of the game
        playerCount - int : number of players for the current instance of the game

    • Method Detail

      • fillBoard

        public void fillBoard(int numOfHiddenObjects)
        Fills the Board[][] matrix with the hidden objects ("Dot.Com Ships")

        The fillBoard() method generates a random set of numbers to determine the row, column, element and direction for the Dot.Com ships that will be stored on the Board[][] matrix. It then calls the placeShip(int, int, String, int) method to place ship at the generated co-ordinates
        Parameters:
        numOfHiddenObjects - int : specifies the maximum number of hidden "ships" that can be stored on the Board[][]

      • placeShip

        private boolean placeShip(int currentRow,
                int currentCol,
                java.lang.String currentObject,
                int currentDirection)
        Places a ship on the specified co-ordinates if it satisfied a fixed set of conditions

        The input row and column values are used evaluated to ensure that no other ship already exists within the bounds of the new ship's position. If a ship already exists in the given range, then the method exits returning false else it places the ship at the given co-ordinates and places a Dot.Com name from the boardElements array.

        The method also generates a unique ID for each ship it places it in the ship.
        Parameters:
        currentRow - int : row where the ship could be placed.
        currentCol - int : column where the ship could be placed.
        currentObject - String : object that should be placed in the Dot.Com ship.
        currentDirection - int : value to identify whether the ship must be placed vertically or horizontally.
        Returns:
        boolean : returns true if a ship is successfully placed at the input co-ordinates, else returns false.

      • isAllCellSelected

        public boolean isAllCellSelected()
        Checks if all cells on the board have already been selected by the players

        The method iterates each cell in the Board matrix and checks if the cell is selected using the DotCom.isSelected() method.
        Returns:
        boolean : if any cell is not yet selected returns false, else returns true

      • isAllGuessesOver

        public boolean isAllGuessesOver()
        Checks if all the hidden guesses on the board has already been selected

        This method iterates through each of the cells on the Board matrix identifying cells with a Dot.Com name set in them. If any such cell in not yet selected then the method returns false, else it returns true denoting that all available guesses on the board are over.
        Returns:
        boolean : true if all guesses have already been selected by the players, else false.

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard(int boardSize)
        Used to display the Game Board.

        The print board method displays a square matrix of the specified board size. Various elements displayed by the printBoard method are:
        • Index positions at the boundary using numbers in the X axis and Letters from boardPositions array on the Y axis
        • Unselected board elements identified by the "~" symbol
        • Hits by the players are identified by "H" symbol
        • Miss by the players are identfied by an empty space at the guess location.
        Parameters:
        boardSize - int : size of the board to be displayed screen

      • readPlayerInput

        public boolean readPlayerInput(int playerNo,
                      java.lang.String guess)
        Sets the current player guess and calls the updateScore() method

        This method sets the current guess for the player by calling the Player.setGuess(String) method sets the currentPlayer to the playerNo parameter and calls the updateScore() method to check the player's guess.

        The boolean return value identifies whether the current player guess is a Hit or a Miss. This is used by the GuessGameLauncher.runGame() method.

        Parameters:
        playerNo - int : index position of the current player in the Players array
        guess - String : guess made by the current player
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the current player guess is a hit, else false
        See Also:
        Player.setGuess(String), updateScore(), GuessGameLauncher.runGame()

      • updateScore

        public boolean updateScore()
        Checks the guess by the current player and updates the game state

        This method checks the guess made by the current player (identified by currentPlayer index position of the Players array) and changes the following elements to update the game state:

        • Adds the HIT_SCORE to the player score in case of a hit
        • Adds the KILL_SCORE to the player score in case of a kill
        • Uses the isKillStreak(int, int) method to identify a kill
        • Sets the cell guessed by the user as selected using the DotCom.setSelected() method

        The method returns true if the guess is a Hit, else returns false

        Returns:
        boolean : true if player guess is a hit, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the player guess is not a valid position on the board
        See Also:
        isKillStreak(int, int)

      • isKillStreak

        private boolean isKillStreak(int row,
                   int col)
        Checks if the current hit is a Kill Streak

        The method checks the current board state to identify if the the player guess resulted in a kill streak (All 3 cells of the ship has been hit by the same player). If the current hit constitutes a kill streak, the method returns true, else false. This is identified by checking if all cells of the ship is selected and that they were all selected by the same user.

        Parameters:
        row - int : row position of current guess
        col - int : column position of current guess
        Returns:
        boolean : true if guess resulted in kill streak, else false

      • showScores

        public void showScores()
        Used to display the final scores of all players and display a leader board

        The method is called once the game has ended. The method identifies the game winner and displays a congratulations to them. It also displays a formatted leader board showing the scores of all players.

      • setCustomPlayerNames

        public void setCustomPlayerNames()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Sets custom name for the players

        The method calls Player.setName(String) method to set custom names for the players to replace the default names set by the GameEngine(int, int) constructor.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of unforeseen errors while reading user names.

      • getGuessRow

        public int getGuessRow(java.lang.String currentGuess)
        Identifies the current row index position from player guess

        The method selects the substring of player guess denoting the row index and identifies the corresponding integer position value using the boardPositions array as reference. It then returns this position.
        Parameters:
        currentGuess - String : contains the guess made by the current player (such as A1, B3, D5 etc)
        Returns:
        int : denoting the corresponding integer index value for the row position on the board

      • getGuessCol

        public int getGuessCol(java.lang.String currentGuess)
        Identifies the current column index position from player guess

        The method selects the substring of player guess denoting the column index and parses the value into an integer using Integer.parseInt(String) method. It then returns this position.
        Parameters:
        currentGuess - String : contains the guess made by the current player (such as A1, B3, D5 etc)
        Returns:
        int : denoting the corresponding integer index value for the column position on the board

      • waitAndExit

        public static void waitAndExit()
        Used to make the console wait for an Enter Key press from the user before exiting the game.
